reviewText:
Dirty Bomb is a class-based arena (style) shooter.
In Dirty Bomb one team must either destroy an objective, repair an objective, or move an objective from point A to B; where the other team will try to stop it.

All Mercs (characters) have different types of equipment: some can heal, drop ammo packs, call in airstrikes, etc.
Loadouts are cards, you receive cards from either getting them dropped at the end of a game, or buying them for 1,000 ingame credits (about 2 matches worth of credits).
Cards have different rarities, the rarer, the more perks you have.
Higher rarity also changes the cosmetics of your character, ie: different camo on clothing and weapons.

Cards can be traded up for several cards of the same rarity plus a small amount of credits.
Each character has 3 different primary and secondary and knives which you might get.
Each character has different roles because of their weapons and equipment, and a different card (loadout) may change your playstyle because of the weapons or perks, etc.

There are 2 mercs which are permanently unlocked, and some mercs you can play as or a limited time because of free-rotation, which cycles mercs every few weeks. You can permanently unlock Mercs with either ingame credits, or cash.
This certainly isn't pay2win, because if you buy a merc, other people may be able to use it in a few weeks.
It only takes about 6-10 hours of playtime to be able to afford a merc with ingame cash anyway.

You can aim down sights, but it is not reccomended as there is nearly no (extreme) recoil, and it slows you down.
Time to kill in this game is considerably long if you go for body shots, which is why headshots are always reccommended, as it's only 2-3 shots with an AR.

Pros and Cons.

Pros:
-Attractive visuals
-F2P, but buying things with cash does not give an unfair advantage
-Accessible game with a high skill ceiling, easy to learn but hard to master
-Free rotation mixes up gameplay
-The game has under level 5" servers for people new to the game
-You're able to walljump twice and keep momentum
date:
making awesome trick jumps and skill based movement possible
-Gun play is great
-Hitboxes seem fine

Negatives:
-Some maps and classes need tweaking
recommended:
ie: longer cooldown for airstrikes
-Lack of gamemodes and maps
-The game requires a lot of communication and team work for your team to be successful.
"
hoursPlayed: July 9, 2015

reviewText: Dirty Bomb is an awesome team-based FPS offering alternate gameplay which you don't see in many other games. What makes the game so unique and fun, is it's simple yet well designed gamemodes and maps. The gamemodes are easy to understand and reinforce the team-based nature of the game as well as making the game exciting and tactical. The use of the merc/class system in the game also allows people to perform particular roles in order for their team to win. The loadout system in the game is a little wierd, but its NOT pay to win. You can get lead,iron and bronze loadouts very easily without spending anything.Although there are silver,gold,cobalt and exclusive cards available, they give no advantage over the bronze ones whatsoever except the aesthetics! There are boosts available too for real money but these provide no advantage in a battle situation. Overall, I would highly recommend you try out this game if you enjoy team-based shooters and like a challenge!

reviewText:
Here's a shooter that's fast, fun, competitive and doesn't have too many crutches for low skill players.
Unlike a lot of popular shooters, you rarely see people calling out people use certain weapons for being too overpowered. Sure there are some broken balancing, but what game doesn't?
Netcode, hitreg, map designs and character designs are great. Unless you purposely join a server with over 100 ping, you'll almost never experience rubberbanding, getting hit when you've reached cover long ago or hits not registering because you died before the latency catched up.

Dirty Bomb operates smoothly, the game mechanics are fun and that's what's important in multiplayer first-person shooters.

The F2P aspect of this game is of no concern either. You can buy the mercs with money, but it takes only 1-3 of playing to get enough in-game credits to buy a new merc. Loadouts can be bought with the same credits and they're even acquired randomly when playing the game. You can increase the chances of getting a high rarity card which is purely cosmetic by buying a different case. There is no P2W in Dirty Bomb.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First of all:  THIS GAME IS NOT PAY 2 WIN SERIOUSLY.
-Yes the loadout cards give SMALL advantages that are no match to actual skill.

-To get best possible advantage out of loadout cards you only need bronze cards and those are fairly easy to obtain.

-The loadout cards beyond bronze are nothing more than a different skin.

-Each merc is fairly balanced, before you say he is over powered search for a way to deal with him.

-The mercs that you are given for free from the start are very powerful.

-There is always rotation of 3 mercs that you can play without buying them and it updates every 2 weeks.

-You can get credits pretty fast for a free game, you can roughly get 10 to 20k credits per day if you complete most challenge the game offers you.

GAMEPLAY
-TF2 mixed with Unreal Tournament gameplay.

-This is a fast paced team play game that requires you to be as good at movement as much as at shooting even if you play slowest merc, yet you shouldn't rush all the time and think what you're doing.

-Each merc features a unique ability that makes him more interesting to play.

-Despite ability to aim with iron sight you shouldn't use it too much as it slows you down a lot and makes you an easy target. You can fire from hip with a fairly reliable accuracy allowing you to both avoid damage and deal it.  So it's a fire from the hip based game.

-The concept of support class aka medics was executed as good as possible, it's fun to play support mercs in this game.

-A lot of voice commands and taunts for every merc.

-Frequent events, give aways and updates.

-Wall jumps, each merc can do 2 wall jumps in a row, it's a small touch of agility that allows you to reach more places and dodge more easily, yet it's fairly hard to master.

-Long jumps, another interesting movement addition, remember the jumping module from half life? (if you played it)
Works exactly the same, to perform one you must sprint crouch and jump at the same time, takes time to get used to.

OVERALL RATING OF THE GAME: 8.9/10
It's defianetly worth your time.

reviewText:
On a scale of 1 to 4 with 4 being Highly Recommended, I give this game a 3.
Pros:
Free
Not pay to win
Fast-paced FPS
Team based objective gameplay
Decent graphics that doesn't demand a high graphics card
There are 17 different mercenaries, each with 9 different loadouts, and will add more in future
So far the developer are very pro active responding to players feedback
Cons:
Although theres plenty of players, sometimes hard to find a server that are empty (Asia)
There's cheaters, but very rare. So far I have meet cheater at most 3 times (I haven't play Competitive yet)
Solo queue in competitive are too long, this is one of the reason I'm too lazy to play competitive
You can't create party with your friends in public matches
Too many mercenaries and loadouts means you need a really good luck trying to gamble for the card you wanted

reviewText:
I approve of the F2P model here, the fact everything above a certain level is just cosmetic is nice and its barely pay to win. But the thing that irks me the most about this game, is the community.

Dont get me wrong, the game is great, been loving it since i started. But i'm getting sick and tired of getting on teams that barely work together, rage when you loose a round, kick you when you dont play a specific merc when they scream at you to do so,  protect any sort of cheating by trying to justify it [plenty of times, one player had a score up in the 10,000s and his team was barely over 1,000 points.]
And please, dont get me started on the idiots who think its okay to pull out a melee weapon and charge at you just to get a kill.

reviewText:
I'll be honest I have been trying so hard to like this game, Its fun in many aspects. But I just can't.

The game is unbalanced, It dosnt matter if you have skill or not in this game if you own the right merc you can take down even the best. In EVE missions skyhammer,arty and kira mercs just spam airstrikes and orbital strikes making the eve unmovable and oh god dont get me started on PHANTOM.

The game crashes all day everyday. Leaving the game? CRASH, Joining a match? CRASH, ooo having a day without any crashes? what a lucky little person you are it would be a shame if you just CRASHED.

The game looks like if all of the most successful fps games (CS:GO,TF2, CoD, Doom, Unreal Tournament) Had an awesome but unpolished baby.  It looks like a good idea on paper but it just isnt executed right

reviewText:
I am supposed to describe what I like or dislike about the game, so lets go over what I have seen.

Dirty Bomb detects Microsoft/Sysinternals Process Explorer as a 'monitor program' and refuses to start. Just shows a vague message box and exits.

That covers my hands-on experience with the game.

I watched people play the game at QuakeCon this year and thought I would give it a try myself because it looks pretty fun.  But the anti-cheat detects a task manager as a 'monitor program' and won't event start the game, so it is getting uninstalled before I ever even see a splash screen.

As the anti-cheat is everything I have to go on to write my review, I would have to say I like nothing about the game, and dislike everything.

Another casualty of bad drm/anti-cheat.

reviewText: This is a very marginal yes.  I should preface the rest of the review with how I really enjoy this game when both teams are fighting hard and somewhat ethically.  I know that seems strange to say, but this game isn't fun otherwise because it's extremely easy to spawncamp.  There aren't any random spawns... you pretty much spawn on top of the corpse they just killed while spawn camping.  Super frustrating.\n\nSo with that in mind, I really don't know what to think of this game.  There's lots of potential and it seems fairly polished and most characters are reasonably balanced.  It's just unfortunate that the programmers didn't think about something like spawning when designing maps.  There's absolutely no way to clear the opposing team out of the spawn once they are there.

reviewText:
TL;DR? Brink and Counter Strike had a baby, but Brink might have also cheated on CS with League of Legends, DOTA, or some other MOBA.
I can't personally say I recommend it to anyone, but if this sounds like your type of thing, go for it. it is free to play afterall.

-Community: 5/10 About what you'd expect from an online game.
-Netcode: 6/10 I've been killed by lag so bad I can't tell if the other guy's cheating or not, so yeah, I've seen better.
-Handling: 8/10 Not the best, but it's pretty fluid.
-Gameplay: 6.5/10 Everything's REALLY F**KING FAST like Quake, and the weird IFF outlines can get lost quickly in tight querters.
-Graphics: 8/10 Pretty good overall for being a f2p game.
-Aesthetics: 7/10 (See Gameplay ^) I heard it's post-apocolyptic, but the game does little to reinforce that feel, and running and gunning at close range gets pretty frantic with how hard it can be to tell friend from foe.

-Overall: I'd say a solid 6/10 or so. Nothing ground breaking, nothing especially BAD. This game /mildly/ suffers what I've come to call Zombie Panic Syndrom" (Go play Zombie Panic! Source to find out.) Be prepared to do a lot of dying due to being made of paper and fighting enemies who always take twice the damage you do
date: no exceptions. (Headshots never seem to kill enemies
hoursPlayed: ect) Though it's not as bad as ZPS or other games that suffer this strange phenomenon. It's a team based game with little team work

letting you get anything in the game if you wanna put in the time for grind. I can't complain and havn't put in a GREAT ammount of time to have a completely solid opinion.

BUT

It's aight."

reviewText:
Dirty Bomb is great, not only its f2p but in a really good condition. The gameplay: classy shooter with objectives but also secondary objectives wich will help the team to succeed faster.
The mercs: you start with 2 mercs a medic(Aura) and a supporter(Skyhammer). Medics can heal injured and revive fallen teammates and supporter are used as ammo supplier but also as fire support. There are lots of mercanarys with different tasks so try it.
Money: this game isnt pay to win/play there is a ingame currency(credits). The prices are high a mercs price is 30.000 to 50.000 but you can get the money easily.
Loadouts: with loadout cards you can get new weapons and skins for your mercanarys wich can be bought(17.000 credits) or unboxed(cases can be opened for free if you got one).
So Dirty Bomb is a fast pased, teambased and free to play shooter, go play it and have fun.

reviewText: Dirty Bomb is a fast paced, objective based FPS. Rather than rewarding those for just killing like Call of Duty, you get points for being an objective player or supportive to your team. It's fun and has a very high skill ceiling for those who want competative gameplay. It's very team oriented, so talking to your team (being nice and not toxic) is a good way to win. Once you get used to each mercs gameplay, you'll see that it's very balanced for what it is and no merc is blatantly overpowered. Even if there is imbalance, the devs update often and are constantly working on new content. There are lots of loadouts with lots of different guns and cosmetic changes for those who like to collect stuff". Overall a great game.\n\nThe tutorial is lack luster and doesn't give new players a firm grasp on what they are doing

reviewText:
Finally, an FPS that keeps me coming back for more.  It has been a long time since I've been actively engaged in an FPS (maybe since RtCW / ET).  The gunplay feels great.  The movement is fast paced and fairly dynamic.

My higher level complaints would be a lack of diversity with objectives (repair/destroy, escort, deliver).  There isn't really a story, as far as I can tell (not that it really matters), but it would be nice to understand WHY one side wants to do one thing or another.

Highly recommend.

* Note:  Anyone who claims this is P2W is completely detached from reality.  No 'Loadout' augments your ability to aim / track and shoot... You're only limited by your own skill, and the skill of your teammates / other team.

reviewText:
Dirty Bomb is great, not only its f2p but in a really good condition. The gameplay: classy shooter with objectives but also secondary objectives wich will help the team to succeed faster.
The mercs: you start with 2 mercs a medic(Aura) and a supporter(Skyhammer). Medics can heal injured and revive fallen teammates and supporter are used as ammo supplier but also as fire support. There are lots of mercanarys with different tasks so try it.
Money: this game isnt pay to win/play there is a ingame currency(credits). The prices are high a mercs price is 30.000 to 50.000 but you can get the money easily.
Loadouts: with loadout cards you can get new weapons and skins for your mercanarys wich can be bought(17.000 credits) or unboxed(cases can be opened for free if you got one).
So Dirty Bomb is a fast pased, teambased and free to play shooter, go play it and have fun.

reviewText:
This may become my 2nd favorite to play FTP in existence (Warface 1st & MWO 3rd).  I only have just entered into it and so can not say with absolute certainty.  Yet from my initial experiences as a game pro I am SUPER impressed.  The visuals are crisp and art well done, the gameplay is smooth as butter albeit seems a litte twitchy in gunplay compared to what I am used to.  The maps are well done, and the game modes varied, and even though I could not tell 100% for sure, I am 99% sure or so that FF was on by default in my first match.  That is completely MIND BOGGLINGLY PRO FOR A TITLE.  As you must know it is rare, yet some like myself WILL NOT EVEN PLAY on Non-Hardcore modes @ all...I am not kiddin.

SO THIS GETS 10/10 just like Warface for my review.  This game is pure brilliance, and the coders did a superb job, and devs and GMs must also be doing fine for this to be so playable in Beta...it's just pure PROCORE gaming all the way.

Not much else I can say beyond that for now, seriously though if you have not tried this yet, you owe it to yourself to give it a whirl and see if it's your thing...

Also wanted to mention I GOT A KILL IN MY FIRST MATCH (well 2nd yet first didn't count as I had it set to critical/realtime by accident and this caused gameglitches so when I set client to a proper HIGH priority it was awesome).  It was a little bit lucky of one, coming near the end, yet I still did it, and I used my support well! (I'm almost always a Med where-ever I go)

reviewText:
If you want a free to play shooter thats not complete garbage get this. If you want to spend time and money on virtual hats and a game that has not fixed simple things like shadows going through walls, poor hit registration, and so on, get tf2.
Seriously, why is this game not more popular?
I have zero complaints. If I had any they have been fixed or are going to be. Devs are super great and updates actually are useful.
No matter what anyone says, this game is not pay to win. I could play 4 matches and get useful cards. Anything above bronze is purely cosmetic. Ive heard people call it pay to win simply because there are case that you can use to get cards of high rarity. But you can get the same cards from a normal case that you find in a match. Not to mention they cost no money to open.
Mercs in this game are handled with an in game currency system. Most mercs are 50,000 credits while others are 30,000. Some people complain about the high prices but they have missions that if you do you can get 3000+ in a couple matches. ( includes completing first match of the day and winning first match of the day. Of those two, both apply to all 3 game modes, so thats 3000 Credits alone from playing + winning a match). Each merc is a counter and is counterable. If you want to get mercs fast, dont waste money on cases and cards. Cards are not the deciding factor in a match. Its player skill. I can do better with a stock card on a merc im good at than i can with a gold card on one im bad at.
My friend was telling me he was concerned that this game is still in beta even though its been about a year and i cant imagine why. If this game said it wasnt in beta i would believe it. Im not 100% sure so dont quote me but i think the only reason this game is in beta is because some on the unlockable mercs were under or over powered and were removed to rebalance. 3 mercs have yet to be added, Turtle, Aimee, and javelin.
plus its free so may aswell try it. Also dont buy proxy or vassile as your first merc people will HATE you.

reviewText: Dirty Bomb is fantastic for a free game.  The gameplay is amazing!  The shooting feels really great and the maps are really good too.  This game is not without its flaws, however. Overall, I'd say give this game a try!

reviewText:
Dirty Bomb is a first person shooter and fast-paced team game that takes place in London, after a mysterious disaster and a failed city decontamination, leaving behind a perfect place for the Private Military Companies who battle to control what remains of the city.
The game is highly competitive and addictive, and teamwork is required to defeat the opponents and be successful.
There's a great variety of mercenaries with different abilities and skills to choose wisely relying mostly on the squad balance and teamwork.
Although there's not a great variety of weapons, the immersive gameplay, amazing visuals and very well-designed maps provide plenty of fun.
I recommend Dirty Bomb.

reviewText:
Once again another fps multiplayer is released but will it be any different from the others?

Dirty bomb is made by british developers splash damage whom have a decent track record so far, such as their involvement in developing games such as Wolfenstein: Enemy territory in 2003 and batman arkham origins in 2013 and not so good games like Brink which was kind of a failure.

Dirty bomb in my opinion is seems to adopt a lot of its ideas from Brink, such as its watercolor art style and objective like gameplay although its doesn't hound the player to do the secondary objectives like in Brink. So is it bad?

In the most part, the gameplay is pretty solid, consisting of objective based gameplay which task players of one team to defend objectives whereas the later to attack and deliver objectives like narcotics etc. Players have a selection 12 different mercs to choose from which is reminiscence to the class system of team fortress, although you will only get access to 3 at the start. The rest are locked and can be bought for real cash or 30000 to 50000 ingame credits depending on the character. Some of them are unlocked temporarily from time to time. Most of the class for the most part are pretty unique with the exception which feel redundant in my opinion but the choices of unlocking which is given to the player which is pretty welcome.

Most of the maps are pretty decent for the most part and the objectives are placed pretty well and encourage teamwork unlike games like Call of Duty which the gameplay is mostly about gaining kills and unlocking kill streaks which is too competitve in my opinion. Dirty bomb succeeds in this case as a significant increase in points is earned by aiding others or doing the objectives which will result in higher XP being earned at the end of the game. This means that one can gain tons of XP by solely assisting others, giving ammo, healing others and from objectives. Movement and shooting are also pretty solid which is much to expected considering Dirty bombs runs with the unreal engine 4. However the objectives can feel meaningless as there are no story or reason for doing so.

However dirty bomb does have its dirty flaws as well. You can't have your own loadout in Dirty bomb, instead loadouts are given in cards which the player wil have no choice in editing. New cards are earned through cases which are reminiscence CS:GO's, but this is one of the games flaws and a sign of corporate being greedy. Drop rates for silver and higher cases are ludicrously low and the game tends to taunt you by having the marker to miss cards with high rarity. What's more the loadouts can't be changed and that the cards that you get are assigned for a character which you might not have.  This results in many useless loadouts being drawn unless of course you buy the god forsaken elite cases which has drop rates of silver and above, cobalt being the best. But to the game's credit, guns aren't too OP like in games like blackshot, so you probably will still get a solid amount of kills with them and that the normal cases can be occasionally obtained for free or for 1000 ingame credits.

Others probs that i have seen, are also a significant degree of pop in even though the game has taken a watercolor like art style which is supposed to counteract this and that there is a persistent sound glitch that appears in the game from time to time which distorts the sound and why is it not possible to make a private room?! This means that if you want to have a match with your group of friends you are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ screwed, gotta wait for a friend too long, TOO BAD. Strangers can pop in whenever they like and if there is a troll, i am sorry, god bless you.

I also encountered a glitch that distorted the model of my teammates like in super smas bros if you swap the character movesets. the objectives can feel meaningless as there are no story or reason for doing so.

Ultimately, solid game, its worth a try considering its free. But is it that good? In my opinion its around a 6.5/10. i recommend it for people who want to get into FPS as many of the skills learned here help transition to other fps games and to people who love games with teamwork and are short of budget.

Thanks for reading and I hope the review is helpful. Pls give feedback as i hope i can improve my skills in writing reviews!
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First of all, I just want to counter-argument everyone who talks negatively about this game's business model, THEN I'll move on to the game itself.
I honestly think that compared to 90% of the F2P games around, this business model, though it doesn't ride the lines of perfection, it almost slides through them. After all, they paid to develop the game, and they need money to keep it alive. And we're talking about Nexon, you're lucky that you can actually be on par with enemy players without paying anything. I'd say you only need to pay for COSMETICS, but if you really want those cosmetics, you can really get them without paying. All weapons are similar and it's all up to preference, and as for the perks, they're just sidekicks, you don't really need them, but they will (sometimes) help you. I currently have 1 Special Edition card (lucky me, RNG), 3 Silvers (traded up from 4 bronze cards each) and currently no Bronze card because I've traded them all up. I also have a BUNCH of Iron and Lead cards, because every 2~4 games you're guaranteed to drop a case for free, rather than wasting 2~3 games worth of currency, which in my opinion, is not a lot.
As for the game, there's not much I can say. I have played in this game's closed beta, and I can only say it has been improving more and more with each update. The gameplay mechanics are fun. The recoil, though very reduced and easily controllable, feels fluid and well conceived.
Now here's what I love: The movement. To me, movement has always been very important in FPS games. From trickjumping back in old Arena shooters like Quake and Unreal Tournament, to bunnyhopping in Half-Life and Counter-Strike, I've always done what I can to learn how to use the movement to my advantage. Ever since I learned this game had a long-jump function, I've been studying the maps as I play to make use of this along with the wall-jumps (and the Springy perk) to get around faster than ever, and to avoid all kinds of enemy attacks. The game is fun and addicting, and though there are still very few maps, they are large enough, and have more than one objective each, which avoids boredom.

reviewText:
I'm absolutely horrified by the reviews. 62/100? 73% positive? What on earth are the reviewers talking about?

Dirty Bomb is a solid F2P shooter (with no pay-to-win features) that, although in beta, shows much promise when it comes out as a game. Most of the complaints I see have to do with balancing, anti-hack, and the browser history EULA.

As for balancing, the game is relatively balanced. Of course, with the release of a new the character Phantom everyone (rightfully) got uptight, but he recieved a nerf only weeks after his release. This game is still in beta, and with the current near-optimal balance, there is no reason to down-vote this game based primarily off of that. Any strat can be countered with another, and all it takes it good teamwork.

Regarding hackers, I have played this game for 20+ hours, and I have only come across one aimbotting sniper in that period of time. Perhaps I haven't played long enough, but I have failed to see hackers throughout my gaming time here. I have no issues with this and cannot say that the anti-hack system is not working.

Now, as for the EULA, that's a matter I am actually upset with. Like other reviewers said, it is infringing on you and isn't really effective. I guess it stops you from searching Dirty Bomb hacks"
date: but that is pretty damn stupid because I doubt it is that effective. Be aware that this is a feature that you will have to agree if you install DB.\n\nOtherwise
recommended: this game is very much enjoyable. As I said above
hoursPlayed: it has zero P2W features in it and is very fun to play
voteText: especially with good communication. Developers are constantly adding updates and hotfixes and are actually listening to player feedback. Get it if you dig a solid shooter.\n\n8/10"

reviewText:
Dirty Bomb is a first person shooter and fast-paced team game that takes place in London, after a mysterious disaster and a failed city decontamination, leaving behind a perfect place for the Private Military Companies who battle to control what remains of the city.
The game is highly competitive and addictive, and teamwork is required to defeat the opponents and be successful.
There's a great variety of mercenaries with different abilities and skills to choose wisely relying mostly on the squad balance and teamwork.
Although there's not a great variety of weapons, the immersive gameplay, amazing visuals and very well-designed maps provide plenty of fun.
I recommend Dirty Bomb.

reviewText:
Once again another fps multiplayer is released but will it be any different from the others?

Dirty bomb is made by british developers splash damage whom have a decent track record so far, such as their involvement in developing games such as Wolfenstein: Enemy territory in 2003 and batman arkham origins in 2013 and not so good games like Brink which was kind of a failure.

Dirty bomb in my opinion is seems to adopt a lot of its ideas from Brink, such as its watercolor art style and objective like gameplay although its doesn't hound the player to do the secondary objectives like in Brink. So is it bad?

In the most part, the gameplay is pretty solid, consisting of objective based gameplay which task players of one team to defend objectives whereas the later to attack and deliver objectives like narcotics etc. Players have a selection 12 different mercs to choose from which is reminiscence to the class system of team fortress, although you will only get access to 3 at the start. The rest are locked and can be bought for real cash or 30000 to 50000 ingame credits depending on the character. Some of them are unlocked temporarily from time to time. Most of the class for the most part are pretty unique with the exception which feel redundant in my opinion but the choices of unlocking which is given to the player which is pretty welcome.

Most of the maps are pretty decent for the most part and the objectives are placed pretty well and encourage teamwork unlike games like Call of Duty which the gameplay is mostly about gaining kills and unlocking kill streaks which is too competitve in my opinion. Dirty bomb succeeds in this case as a significant increase in points is earned by aiding others or doing the objectives which will result in higher XP being earned at the end of the game. This means that one can gain tons of XP by solely assisting others, giving ammo, healing others and from objectives. Movement and shooting are also pretty solid which is much to expected considering Dirty bombs runs with the unreal engine 4. However the objectives can feel meaningless as there are no story or reason for doing so.

However dirty bomb does have its dirty flaws as well. You can't have your own loadout in Dirty bomb, instead loadouts are given in cards which the player wil have no choice in editing. New cards are earned through cases which are reminiscence CS:GO's, but this is one of the games flaws and a sign of corporate being greedy. Drop rates for silver and higher cases are ludicrously low and the game tends to taunt you by having the marker to miss cards with high rarity. What's more the loadouts can't be changed and that the cards that you get are assigned for a character which you might not have.  This results in many useless loadouts being drawn unless of course you buy the god forsaken elite cases which has drop rates of silver and above, cobalt being the best. But to the game's credit, guns aren't too OP like in games like blackshot, so you probably will still get a solid amount of kills with them and that the normal cases can be occasionally obtained for free or for 1000 ingame credits.

Others probs that i have seen, are also a significant degree of pop in even though the game has taken a watercolor like art style which is supposed to counteract this and that there is a persistent sound glitch that appears in the game from time to time which distorts the sound and why is it not possible to make a private room?! This means that if you want to have a match with your group of friends you are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ screwed, gotta wait for a friend too long, TOO BAD. Strangers can pop in whenever they like and if there is a troll, i am sorry, god bless you.

I also encountered a glitch that distorted the model of my teammates like in super smas bros if you swap the character movesets. the objectives can feel meaningless as there are no story or reason for doing so.

Ultimately, solid game, its worth a try considering its free. But is it that good? In my opinion its around a 6.5/10. i recommend it for people who want to get into FPS as many of the skills learned here help transition to other fps games and to people who love games with teamwork and are short of budget.

Thanks for reading and I hope the review is helpful. Pls give feedback as i hope i can improve my skills in writing reviews!

reviewText:
First of all, I just want to counter-argument everyone who talks negatively about this game's business model, THEN I'll move on to the game itself.
I honestly think that compared to 90% of the F2P games around, this business model, though it doesn't ride the lines of perfection, it almost slides through them. After all, they paid to develop the game, and they need money to keep it alive. And we're talking about Nexon, you're lucky that you can actually be on par with enemy players without paying anything. I'd say you only need to pay for COSMETICS, but if you really want those cosmetics, you can really get them without paying. All weapons are similar and it's all up to preference, and as for the perks, they're just sidekicks, you don't really need them, but they will (sometimes) help you. I currently have 1 Special Edition card (lucky me, RNG), 3 Silvers (traded up from 4 bronze cards each) and currently no Bronze card because I've traded them all up. I also have a BUNCH of Iron and Lead cards, because every 2~4 games you're guaranteed to drop a case for free, rather than wasting 2~3 games worth of currency, which in my opinion, is not a lot.
As for the game, there's not much I can say. I have played in this game's closed beta, and I can only say it has been improving more and more with each update. The gameplay mechanics are fun. The recoil, though very reduced and easily controllable, feels fluid and well conceived.
Now here's what I love: The movement. To me, movement has always been very important in FPS games. From trickjumping back in old Arena shooters like Quake and Unreal Tournament, to bunnyhopping in Half-Life and Counter-Strike, I've always done what I can to learn how to use the movement to my advantage. Ever since I learned this game had a long-jump function, I've been studying the maps as I play to make use of this along with the wall-jumps (and the Springy perk) to get around faster than ever, and to avoid all kinds of enemy attacks. The game is fun and addicting, and though there are still very few maps, they are large enough, and have more than one objective each, which avoids boredom.

reviewText:
Tentative positive review, since the game is in beta still.

Pros:
1) The game mechanics are fun, fast paced and objective oriented
2) It is NOT p2w. You can easily buy everything you need with ingame money, which are easy enough to make. All upgrades after Bronze quality are purely cosmetic.
3) No killstreaks and only moderate reward for killing at expense of objective game
4) Maps have progression from one objective to another, so the game is less stale as the match progresses

Cons:
1) Maps have design issues with spawn locations. Some are too easy to camp. Others too easy to defend.
2) Maps are a bit narrow for 8v8. Unless defending team is vastly inferior, it is impossible to lose in 8v8.
3) Anti-cheat is garbage, and the amount of cheaters seems to be growing since the time I picked up the game. This is made worse by vote-out option not working well.
4) No built-in auto-balance, often resulting in very one-sided games.
5) Joining game that is already in progress puts you into the lobby, where you have to wait for countdown again. Too much waiting all around.
6) Server usually empties out after the match is over, resulting in unstable matches and poor community. Various reasons. Some people leave to open their loot, some leave due to lack of auto-balance, some just don't want to wait for match to start and rather find another server.

----

I am willing to write off the cons for the beta for now, but devs seem to be rather focused on pumping out new classes (i.e. new content) rather than fixing issues with the game.

reviewText:
First off let me say I am by no means an FPSer but here is what I think:

This game is equally good and bad. The gameplay is fun and fast paced. A great 'arcade' style shooter. There is definitely many hours of fun to be had especially if you are a fan of games like TF2 or UT. Also if you like to jump alot.... there is A LOT of jumping like a bunny on beans in this game.

Good things:

Diverse gameplay. With the plethora of mercs available anyone can find something to suit their gamplay. From full on support to heavy armors, grenadeers and even ranged revivals this game has got something for every palate.

Active servers. Its very easy to find a game and they have limited servers (ie max lvl 5) for new players to not get owned straight away

Great fun and encourages team play.

Graphics are very good and also the voice acting/character designs are great!

The bad things (and there are a few but its Beta and they're still developing):

Hackers! Yes this game is riddled with them. Due to Nexon's atrociously bad AC system not only do hackers get through but none hacking players will also get booted quite frequently. There is no report system and the hackers don't even get banned, not even for 'x time' so they just jump striaght into the game again.

Grind! Yes you do start with a few mercs and yes they are very good to put free rotations of mercs in but unless you are willing to shell out a fair few pennies then it will be a grind for igc as most mercs tend to cost 30-50K

Basekilling/spawnr*pe! So you're on the losing team... ok. You're being overwhelmed by the enemy... fair enough. They can actually come and stand in your spawn area and obliterate you before you can even take 1 step - yea not so fun. I know its all down to the player and I for one, hang back at the objective zone to actually let them play. I honestly hate spawncampers from both perspectives as it just ruins the fun of the game.... on to...

Community! As with most FPS titles you'll find A LOT of abuse being spewed forth. There is every 'ist' uner the sun here, sexist, racist etc and you will definitely have to put the blinkers on if you don't like profanity! Also there are lot of 'solo' players and this is definitely a team game. If you are a medic, res! If you are support spam ammo! It just doesn't get done.

Input lag or just server lag in general! Sometimes you just can't lay that mine or you'll go round a crner only to find yourself either dead a second later or back where you started.


Those are just the main things that spring to mind but for a free to play game its great and worth a download if you even remotely find this sorta thing fun.

reviewText: Dirty Bomb is one of those games where you pick it up expecting something seen before, and realize it's much more than that. While currently in open beta I feel this game provides a level of enjoyment I have not seen in a while, and with new content on the way as well as a friendly and helpful forum community it's easy for players to get along. The moderators are all fun down-to-earth people who just as excited for new content and bug fixes as we the community are. I would recommend this game in it's current state knowing full well that it's future will be even brighter and more incredible than it is now.

reviewText:
SplashDamage are a good company, ET:QW (Enemy Territory: Quake Wars) was one of my favourite games. This is a evolution of that with elements that force you to play as a team.

I know its beta, but based on what I have played the game is seriously unbalanced.

Most  people are playing the the fast mobile classes of Merc, bouncing round with shotties or high rate firing SMGs. Makes any other class kind of pointless at the moment. You really need to balance the quick moving, bunny hopping shotgun classes as they make a mockery of the game if you try to play any other class. Their health, agility and weapon mean you can empy a clip into them and they just bounce right up to you still with 50% health.

Guns are mostly peashooters take way too many bullets for a kill, and as there hardly any recoil to speak of iron sight aiming is a total handicap. You can get a guy down to 10% health after 1 whole mag of an SMG, yet a boucing shotgun player will nail you super quick.


As most, if not all combat is close quarters there is no role for the slower Mercs.

Card system is abysmal, and the selection of guns you get is tiny and you get what card gives you. Although you can swap cards (laodout), you can only do this between games in lobby, not in game.

Here in lies the clue that this will totally become pay to win, better card cost more money and take forever to earn in game, plus the fact that Nexon have a history of pay to win games.

Feels like a game that was going to get dropped as a pay for release, but they decided to squeeze it for some ££$$ instead.

reviewText: Since I wanted to make rent this month I couldn't afford to pay for the characters that either cost the in game currency or real money I only had time to try three of the characters that were free. That being said while the game is fast paced, which can lead to some fun times, unfortunately people who've payed cash from the get go seem to have serious advantage over new players. Not to mention the games anti-cheat is a joke. In the three hours I played i ran into at least 10 games where there were VERY obvious script kiddies running around with the sniper class shooting me and my teammates through walls and various objects with ludicrous speed. In all if this game was a full one time purchase of maybe 40 or so dollars I probably would purchase it. And then just have microtransactions for costume items or small utilities. But when a new merc costs 50k in game currency, when you only make roughly 400 a game, it's an obvious attempt to coerce players into spending cash on this game. If they open the game up a little more and enact better anti-cheat this game could be a lot better.

In all seriousness, this is a very fun, somewhat class based FPS with awesome voice acting for the many mercs you can play as. reviewText:
This is a fast paced game and a mix of Counterstrike and Team Fortress

+ Not Pay 2 Win
+ Easy to earn ingame currency that you can use to get access to everything this game has to offer.
+ The game somehow makes you play the objective. You won't see very many players doing their own thing
+ For the most part the mercs are well balanced and all serve a purpose
+ Well balanced maps
+ Sound and graphics are good but nothing too exciting

- Matchmaking needs work since many times the teams are way too imbalanced
- Some bugs here and there but nothing gamebreaking
- Execution Mode could use some more maps
- Objective mode seems obsolete and unfair". Stopwatch mode is the way to go
- Real money prices are way too high but you can enjoy the game without spending a dime

After almost 130 hours i have encountered 4 confirmed hackers in the game and they were reported.
Most of the time people accuse very good players for hacking.
Good players in this game can achieve pretty high K/D ratios from time to time and seem like they are too good to be legit.

Since this is a free and overall fun game i can safely recommend it
Give it some time and then decide if it is worth it for you to spend money and look cooler
If you are patient and use your ingame currency the right way then there is no real need to spend any money"

reviewText:
T.L.D.R. One of the best competitive/hardcore FPS's out there...and its FREE. If you enjoy fast paced shooters, that rely on teamwork to complete multiple objectives across huge maps and have a ton of depth, you need to try it.


Pro's:
-solid and rewarding shooting mechanics; speed of combat is somewhere between Quake and CS Go and the time to kill is much higher then in most games witch is good because that means you can react
-easy to get into, hard to master (aim for the head, fire in short bursts, always keep moving, DON'T zoom in while shooting...it sounds simple but you will be surprised)
-the game is based on teamwork and cooperation. The game rewards that and thus it feels satisfying to play your class well
-every class is capable of putting up a fight while still doing it's job(heal, disarm etc) and I feel like anyone can find a character they love even within a class they may not be too fond of (for example you have a medic like Aura that holds positions very well, or someone like Phoenix that fights and heals on the front line while moving)
-good amount of weapons/perks/classes to play around with
-has a LOT of hidden depth (just watch some wall jumping videos to see what I mean)
-NO Pay2Win whatsoever, business model is decent...combination between Hearthstone and League. You can unlock ANYTHING with in-game currency or try your luck with card packs (just don't overdo it)
-maps are expertly designed, don't be fooled...even if the number is small, this is because the maps are huge and they all have multiple objective stages, so basically you have 3 maps in 1
-dev's balance everything in the game regularly and so far I have never seen a balance patch that did something wrong, I believe the game is heading in a good direction

Note:
-after playing Overwatch I feel like this game, because of the maps and mechanics is a better shooter while OW is a better action game and is much more accessible because a lot of characters don’t rely purely on their guns. I do feel however that because of it’s simplicity, DB is easier to balance, while OW has much more flashy abilities and combos, similar to mobas, that you can pull off and kill entire teams, which feels bad when it happens to you. In DB you rarely get 1 shot randomly because someone just spamm fires a corner with infinite ammo, or just enter a killing field because some OP ability was activated right as you walk by, so it feels less frustrating to play, even solo, but it doesn’t matter what class you play, in DB you need to be good at shooting to be effective.

Con's:
-the prices are too steep IMO, both real money and in-game currency, still, it's a free game.
-there is no party matchmaking outside of ranked play
-the characters usually only have 1 ability unique to them and while they do help you and the team out, they are pretty dull and unimpressive (or you could say, realistic)


My suggestion is: if you want to spend money on something, get a starter pack or just buy the character you know you will enjoy (try them out on free rotations). Cases are basically card packs from hearthstone, you might get a card for a class/character you will never play/own, don't waste money on them, just wait until you have a lot of characters and you want more loadouts or skins (always fun to invite friends over and take turns opening card packs, but don't expect to get anything useful)

Overall: highly recommended.

reviewText:
Note:I may have little playtime here but i played a ton when it was using the nexon launcher last year.

So let's start.For anyone who played splash damages earlier games you'll see a lot of similarities.

What i like the most about this game is that it supports a lot of playstiles (lone wolf,team player etc)
The objective based modes really make this game stand out amongst the crowd the shotting is fun it seems balanced from what i played so far altough they nerfed Proxy which was my favourite to play as (mines everywhere).This game really rewards skill much like cs:go.For example while camping might get you a kill or two you will soon get killed because everyone moves quickly and scoping really isn't needed.The maps are well designed Terminal being my favourite.The character system is really a breath of fresh air because so much games use the same old class system which really has many flaws.The characters they use are really varied and fun to use each having their special abilities and weapons.Each character can plant bombs or revive teammates but certain characters do it faster then others.
Graphics are nice the ui is really intuitive which is not really what i can say for too many f2p games.

So all in all i do recommend Dirty Bomb since it's a really solid team based shooter.

reviewText:
A great game - well put together gameplay, coherent style, and occasional content-filled updates. All content can be paid for with real money or in-game credits. However, using Dirty Bomb's in-game credits to purchase all of the mercenaries and individual loadout cards doesn't feel overburdening; Doing missions (player goals that are refreshed every ~3 hours) will get you plenty of credits and trying out the free-rotation mercenaries (3 mercenaries you can try for free which are changed every week) will occupy your time while acquiring credits.

If you're looking for a fast-paced, class-based first person shooter, you will not be disappointed with Dirty Bomb.

Optimization and RNG of card drops could use a little help though...

reviewText:
Dirty Bomb is awesome fast-paced shooter game that is far away from P2W kind of games.

If you keep playing the game, everything is available for you.
If you keep playing enough, you will earn credits for being able to unlock and hire new mercenaries.
You can't by weapons from stores, but you have access to loadouts. The best loadouts you can get in the game are already available in bronze loadouts. Everything above bronze is all about skins and extra bling bling.
Silver, gold or cobalt loadout aren't better than bronze loadout. And what's the best part? You are able to buy bronze loadout for every merc with 17,5 K credits! Even freeloaders can do well in the game!
Of course you have a chance to purchase with real money some expert and elite cases and get a bit higher chance to get some bling bling, but like I said earlier: it's only about skins, nothing else. Also nothing guarantees that you can get exactly the loadout you are looking for. Even if you purchase 35 elite cases, you still have a chance to get huge pile useless loadouts. It's all about luck.
Also I should not forget to mention that normal cases drops now and then, if you just keep playing the game.
From normal case you are also able to get high rariry loadouts, if you are lucky enough.
Though you can also use your credits for trading up loadouts and you can reach even cobalt loadouts by trading up and you can get higher rarity loadouts by that way.

The game has variation between classes and mercenaries:
Learn what are strongest parts of different mercs and what are weaknesses.
Learn how to use abilities and find the most suitable mercs and weapons that supports your very own playingstyle.
Players are all different and so are mercenaries as well. Find your favorites and go to put the show on the road!
And what comes about cheaters, every game have them. I've seen huge decrease of cheaters in public matches and competitive matches, when the new anti-cheat got released. Even when having less cheaters is a good thing, it's good to remember that new anti-cheat is not a silverbullet. The game without cheaters is only a dream and does not exist.
Though it's a fact that less cheaters is always better. It's the amount that matters after all.

I would recommend this game to everyone who like fast-paced shooter games. ;)

reviewText:
If you like Team Fortress 2 and fast paced modern shooters you may very much like this game.

However! Too many microtransactions! Everything is way too expensive. Trying to buy heroes to play as costs a whooping 50,000 in game credits or as much as $10.00 USD. The whole loadout system is weird as well, don't like your gun or its sights and modifications? Too bad! There is nothing you can do about it except to buy these crates in which you can only hope you will get something better!

I get that its a free game and the devs gotta make money some way, but the way they are doing it is too much. It really takes the fun out of the game once you start playing with better players. I'd say to make things less expensive to purchase, remove some certain microtransactions here and there, and fix the customization for weapons.

I'd give it a solid 6/10 because of this.

TL;DR Game has overpriced transactions effectively making the game a Pay2Progress or as some may take it as a Pay2Win.

reviewText:
NOTE* I dont have near as many hours on this game as I want, out of country for work so playing a shooter is pretty hard right now, but will be trying to log more hours and keep my review updated, thank you!

TL:DR The game is fun, a shooter with ADS, funny jokes are cracked during combat, anti nade spamming with battlefield style classes.  Its free to play, shut up and download it.

FULL BETA REVIEW (Its really not that long)
Where should I start? This is one of the best shooters I have played since my first experience with Call of Duty when I was a kid.  It has jokes that remind you have TF2, play style that reminds of you CS:GO, and classes that remind you of Battlefield, and MOBA style of character rotation.  But the best thing about this free to play shooter…. Aim down sight.
With spending a decent amount of time playing CS:GO, I was not a fan of no ADS (Aim Down Sight)
I see why people like it, and I could even see how it makes things a tad more competitive, but its just not realistic… I mean come on, you don’t see that much hip fire all the time.  Dirty Bomb’s ADS is great, and the speed in which your characters are able to move around makes ADS rather challenge and up close, almost impossible.

For this one, we’ll do a simple pros and cons.

Pros:
- Character Rotation Gives a great experience every week
- Case Rewards are much more frequent in game than others, and do not require cash shop keys to open
- Great server filtering system, with rooms that are locked to up to level 5 for the new players.
- Aim Down Sight, talked about this already but that’s how much I love.
- Very Unique characters providing different “abilities” giving you a wide variety of play.
- You’re able to bring 3 characters into a fight so you’re not locked to the same person the entirety of a match.

Cons:
- Game will often crash if you are unable to connect to a server
- The cases that you’re able to buy can provide a significant benefit during a match giving you superior guns, the game does a decent job combatting this giving you the ability to “Trade Up” your load our cards to higher tier load outs, and the in game earned cases have slight chances of landing a high tier load out, this does take a lot longer and for someone starting out, you may get smacked around by someone with superior weapons, but all in all it’s a shooter, guns are guns and headshots still shred.
- In order to equip new load outs, you have to back out of your lobby and go back to the main menu.
- Some maps are completely one sided and makes it almost impossible for either defending or the attacking team to complete the object.
- There are some gun balancing issues.

Please understand that this is still in Beta and the game will continue to develop.  The developers seem to be very active in checking Reddit and Twitter and overall listening to the community so I am very excited to see everything they have in store for this game.  I gave it an easy 8/10 for a beta, and is right now my favorite shooter for PC, the game is free to play so you have no reason to not give it a shot!

If you liked this review and would like to see the other games I have already covered or would like to stay updated on future, you can visit my website at www.thatsaverage.com or my blog at www.thatsaverage.tumblr.com

reviewText:
Preface: I used to go through canary wharf and london bridge station and I didnt remember they looked anything like this lol
Oh it's the future.

if Team Fortress 2 and Call of Duty fornicated and had an offspring, this might be what it would look like.

You have different classes (named mercenaries in the game) that wield different weapons and perks as well as special skills. There are male and female characters from various races, with different voices.

This game also has case system, which similar to Dota 2's chest or CSGO's crates. However, these cases do not require keys to unlock.

More importantly, I find no pay-to-win micro-transactions so far. You can buy cases to unlock mercs, and so on. Do prove me if I'm wrong

I used to play Hawken (I still do, only less often) and Tribes Ascend (not anymore, was really great), and Dirty Bomb will be one of my favorite F2P FPS if the dev does not ♥♥♥♥ things up.
(7.8 - 8.2) / 10 ( 'cause of Beta ver) would kill again.

reviewText:
Rotation-based Free Heroes, Each with a unique skillset and playstyles. Sounds familiar? should be since this is what most MOBAs revolve around.

But this aint no MOBA. This is a fast paced, Action packed and funny as heck competative FPS. And for an early access title, its GOOD!
This game is what Brink wanted to be but never really did. Cooperative-based PvP Objective based exciting shooty action!

Now to the gameplay aspects: YOu gein 3 Heroes each week to freely play, of these + all heroes you own you pick 3 Heroes or Mercs" (Fittingly) to take into play. That allows you to switch up tactics on the fly or try out some Mercs. When you die
date: you can pick as wich Merc you have with you you respawn. Every Merc will be equipped with a Loadout Card
hoursPlayed: and possible skills
voteText: like less damage of your explosives
helpfulPercent: an extra mag upon respawn or increased health. You get theses from Loadout Caches
votesHelpful: which can be awarded after a game or bought from the In-Game Store.\n\nNow
votesTotal: this seems to be everything a F2P Model has. Unlockable Heroes and buyable Equipment - but here is the thing the thing that actually deals with your combat strength - the Loadout cards - can only be bought with Credits the in-Game Currency. Since I have not yet seen a Real Money -> Credits option (yet) You can not buy yourself better equip (but it also lacks any variety in packs
votesFunny: as in stronger packs containing only a certain rarity and up). But then again

Early Acces. A lot is subject to change.

For now the game is fast paced fun on big maps that rquire every players skills to complete.

To finish

reviewText:
Remember Brink, that game that everyone though it would be amazing, and then was such a majestic piece of sh#t on release, nearly unplayable and extremely lazy? Turns out the devs didn't kill themselves out of shame, and instead came out with this neat game as apology.

So, what IS Dirty Bomb? Weird, that's what it is. As usual, I'll start explaining the BAD stuff of the game, and then move onto the good stuff, and the stuff that could improve.

One of the biggest problems that this game seems to have, is it's lack of identity. It seems that the devs were not sure where to make this game a Moba-shooter" or a "Team-based shooter"
date: so they mixed things up. Kind of badly. Let me explain: In games such as Team Fortress 2
recommended: you need to switch from class to class depending of the situation. Can you do that here? Kinda. You can only change into one of your three pre-selected classes. And how many classes are there? Arround 15 or so. What's the deal? And that's not even the worst: Only 2-3 are free

reviewText: I played a bit when it was just Nexon publishing it and you had to download their launcher. The game was incredibly fun because of two things.\nFor one it was fast paced. I'm not a very heavy FPS guy after having played Quake. Anything else just feels like a slow game and unbearable. I'll play CoD, BF, and other shooters. I just can't stick to them because of pacing issues. Dirty Bomb makes matches go by fast because objectives are near you, and there will be lots of killing. Enough to occupy your time but not overstay their welcome.\nSecond thing it does right is the amount of varied classes. You can be a healer, an Engineer, a Tank, a Sniper, a fast shotgunner, nader, Ninja, and quite a few more. You're not stuck to the traditional Gunner
hoursPlayed: Sniper" classes you're used to in modern shooters.\n\nNow with the integration of Steam there are real people to play with. The people I invited to the closed beta from a few months ago wouldn't touch the game because they didn't want another launcher. Now they've got no excuse
voteText: and it's good to see so many people playing now.\n\nIf I were to rate my favorite FPS games
helpfulPercent: Dirty Bomb would sit comfortably high up on my list with Quake. Both great games I enjoy to play and will continue to play as long as there's a community willing to play."

reviewText:
6/30/2015-

Fun arcade style fps, yes. Competitive shooter, no! (They want it to be viewed on competitve scale)

-Maps are too small in relation to respawn timer. You dont really feel the pressure of a bad choice.

-Theres no reason to help anyone up IF YOUR NOT A MEDIC, combat is always 1-5 seconds away from your spawn. The pick up time is so extreme, its a pointless feature.

-Game promotes and encourages you to stack up by design but is countered by a single player with explosives focus or by all means run all medics.

-At its core all guns share very similar dps, and are shared by classes. Pick your HP/SPEED/UTILITY.


Personal grievances:

-When revived by medic (instant get up) the revive-e is Invulnerable to any form of damage for a good 1-2 seconds

-If a team is significantly better, your forced to let them pummel you for the full 15 mins. no /surrender

-I see the same people time after time

In closing, the diversity in characters is negligible in relation to thier impact of the game aside from medic. Experainces may differ drasticaly based on skill lvls of play :P. There are much better games in this market, the lifetime of this game is very short, Good practice for overwatch. Free to play, I encourage the concepts of this game.

reviewText:
+ decent shooting mechanics; heavily emphasizes tracking aim instead of twitching for one hit kill headshots like pretty much every other shooter
+ you can't buy power with money and it's quite light on the grinding department

- development is extremely slow; we still don't have the complete cast of characters from closed alpha/beta available
- cash shop is overpriced in every aspect and lacking in content, it's 2016 and all the skins are just re-textured versions of the default ones
- performance seems to be based on an imaginary lottery ticket that you're given when you hit the install button

With that said it's still the only shooter that is worth playing at the moment since the core gameplay is good for keeping your fps skills up-to-par, however the game generated poor first impressions around the initial open beta hype so the future doesn't look too bright for Dirty Bomb.

Why is this game bad?
Matchmaking!
Its easy:
40% of matches you get stomped, 40% of matches you stomp and the rest are fair matches...
Thist really gets frustrating after a time.
Pub playing? Yeah it seems people just get thrown randomly together.
Matchmaking? I have always at least 3-4 unranked players in the game, so their skill isn't even rated, also the waiting times for a ranked match are catastrophic (i often wait 10-15 min). Also ofc after the long waiting time the the tolerance for which players play together is realy bad.

All in all this game is could make fun, i mean the game at its core its really good and fun, but this bad matchmaking is really ruining everything. And i don't see the devs making any real progress here, even their ranked matchmaking imho made things worse than better.

Too Dirty!
The anticheat system is completely broken banning and kicking players for seemingly nonsence and letting obvious cheaters play and win games like nobody's business.
The desparity between new players and grizzled veterans is unbearable. The matchmaking system doesnt work putting 20 lvls against 4-6 lvls which makes them lose every time and not make any XP which slow progress and turns players away!

*UPDATE*
Competetive mode finally worked for me after 2 hours of search(i tried several times in the last 3 days waiting for up to 30 minutes each). Like i said previously matchmaking doesnt work pitting me against 22, 16 and 13 lvl players while i had 5 people 9,8,7,6,6 lvl in my team, moreover they had already played a bunch of games and had their ranks settled while we had only 2 players who had been ranked. Surprising thing is that we won, while chat was filled with wailing and screaming about cheaters FROM BOTH teams. Anticheat is not only broken it's killing the community. yeah... It's not a game, it's a wreck.
*UPDATE*24/09/15*
New lobby system is unplayable. Not only there's still no funtionality to play with friends. now you cant even switch team before game starts. Also you dont know which team you are going to play on and there is no way to pick appropriate class so you are stuck playing defensive classes on attacking team and vice versa. Piling negative factors one on another. Anti-user friendly.

reviewText:
Alright I am rewriting this review after a little under 100 hours of playtime.  The gunplay is still very solid with each weapon feeling a little different.  I still highly recommend this game as a W:ET veteran.  Where it goes from here as far as monetization goes will always be a topic of contention but as of right now there is no direct pay to win.

Everyone has the same basic weapons which are dictated by loadouts that you buy with credits you earn in game and are bound to your characters in the form of cards.  There are tiers listed as Lead through Gold with any tier above Bronze serving only to adjust weapon skins.  Bronze cards house the maximum of 3 perks on the card.  Credits are only earned in game or (as of only now) you can buy into the closed beta which I can see being a bit of a joke, but it's worth it for 35000 in game credits and all of the available mercs.  Even if the game flops I already have had plenty of hours of enjoyment and I still find it very enjoyable even with it's future unknown.

This game is Objective based a lot like Team Fortress 2 and like the game's developer Splash Damage's previous games (W:ET, Quake Wars, *cough* Brink *cough*).  The nice thing about this is it naturally aspires to be a little bit competitive as the entire match is about working together to accomplish some task as the enemy team tries to prevent you.  There's plenty of holds and breaks and during many even matches it can come down tot a single flanking Proxy laying strategic mines and assassinating an Aura and/or a Fragger preventing any hope at the objective.  There is room for Heroes and K/D chasers, although without the former the latter loses much of it's glory and this is where the classes can synergize well.

That being sad - the classes as of now are not very well balanced.  There is a merc named Fragger that is extremely difficult to tussle with, regardless of your class.  Pretty much 10/10 times if you come up against him and he's at full health you're a goner.  He can kill you before you pull your special or have a chance to run.  In reality his only nemesis is Vassili who is another very OP character.  This is talking pure damage output.  If you throw in the factor there is a merc named Aura who is also 'OP' you may be thinking 'Hey - sounding more balanced all the time...?' but this is not the case.  Only one of these mercs can counter the other.  That's Fragger.  The other two in a standard midrange heads up shootout die to Fragger again.

In any case, the previous paragraph is something you only come to understand after many hours in the game.  At this point you WILL bein love with the game if you were a fan of SD's prevoius attempts at the genre.  Personally I was a W:ET buff to the extreme.  I adored the game.

Good Hitboxes/solid multiplayer
Nice weapon 'feel'
Futuristic Design


-No ability to mod
-Few maps

-/+ Card system

reviewText: It's a fun shooter that you can dip in and out of without fear of being penalised for not sticking the whole way through a game - and the game is designed such that doing so won't affect the experience of the rest of your team much, too. The graphics aren't triple-A but they still look great and it runs really well, and I think the clean TF2-esque graphics help add to the experience. The display doesn't look cluttered, the voice acting is good quality and the online experience is fun without hitches. I'm still getting used to it, but you're not bombarded with different load-out settings or unlockable items - the interface makes it simple to understand what is going on. The sufficient variety different classes" of online characters makes it easy to have at least some form of balanced teamwork (where at least one player can perform certain roles on a team) without having to pick from a million different powers and abilities like some games do (cough cough Battlefield).\nIn short
date: if you like playing Titanfall style multiplayer games and don't mind a bit less serious gameplay then you'll enjoy this game."

reviewText:
Its a brilliant idea, like if Brink wasnt made so badly, and its very well done. Simple shooter with a moba like hero system

When it first came out it was amazing, but right now (forgivably though, since it is being tuned over time) its a mess of spawn killing, one sided maps, air strike spam and more of a fight of which team has the more of the OP classes more than any significant level of skill (which classes are OP depends on how its tuned that day. Previously it was the Phantom, but they fixed him a little too hard). Not to mention they altered the way the servers handle hit rego and such since then (intentionally or not) so it has a tendency to not register some blatant hits in the same way youd find in CSGO and the like.
However most of the issues that are derived from the community only really pop up once you go past level 5 and have to go into the uncontrolled rank matches (for some reason the devs thought having <5 servers and >10 server but nothing between was a good idea)

It aint terrible, by any means, and its free. So give it a try, i recommend it all the same. But come in with an open mind or youll be turned away pretty quick by the flaws it does have.

reviewText:
<closed beta review on 2015.04.27>
We are still in a suburb of London, trying to find out what hit us. Enemy forces have forced us back to the soulless town, whilst we had the initial order to progress forward. All seems wrecked, but I'm not willing to let 'em conquer any further. Their days will end today. They will end now at our defense. We are strong, we WILL keep stand and will protect our wealth. Remember: We are here to get some s##tload of money. And now go and defend it!

Teams on public seem to be unbalanced, so we didn't even know what hit us even if three of us were on duty together. Matchmaking in the wild seems to be the biggest issue so far, life itself is wonderful.

Rushing with Proxy can give you a kick or break your neck, whilst Bushwrecker is his own man crew. Fragger will always seem to win with his grens, but it is more complicated than you think it is. Vassili takes it up from far away, but he's getting cloned all too fast. Sawbonez is ready to battle it in with his devib, while Aura remains calm defending her healing station. So many of us died here - yet there seems to be an endless wave rushing the enemy.

After all, you just have too keep an eye on the uhb-jek-tiv, and don't be a d##k. That's all what's needed. But don't forget about these - you don't need K/D ratio, you should not camp if not ordered so by mission control - after all, it's the team that wins, and not you. You simply shall not do it the same way you did before - else we will loose everything. Understood, soldier?

And now get your f###ing a## to the objectiv and bring it to the EV!
</end of review>

reviewText: A fast-paced cooperative fps, very fun and very reliant on teamwork. The game doesn't focus on k/d ratio as hard as objectives and using your merc appropriately. The devs a are still making many changes to this game and they do listen to the commnunity, sometimes good, sometimes bad, however it does show they are trying to work with everyone to build a solid game. They also currently run twitch streams Mondays and Wednesdays to take in ideas and questions, and Shoe is VERY good at answering most and talking to everyone about what's going on.\n\nThere are definitely some bugs, cheaters, issues, etc. but the game isnt fully released and the devs do address issues and are working to fix them. I personally do not see this as a pay to win, but a pay to skip.. However taking that route to me would make the game incredibly boring. The way it's laid out there are always things to work for, and its gratifying once you do. Time will tell what direction the game goes down the road, but I have good faith in it!

reviewText:
I'll keep it short.

Dirty Bomb is a solid teamplay-focused fps.
It's fast, it's fluid and it's pretty well balanced.
The mercs are not just some generic meatheads.
Every single one of them is full of character and humor
(some of the one-liners are truly golden).
Also - this is one of the few F2P shooters, that
deserve being called F2P. All mercs can be bought with
ingame currency, same with loadouts.

There's really no reason not to try it, that is, if you like shooters.

reviewText:
Dirty bomb is quite fun, out of the time I've played it I've not had too many moments where I've gotten board off the game itself, rather my awful attention span. My only real complaint so far with the game is you better make damn sure the first merc you buy is the one you want, the grind to buy mercs for free is absurd with the missions (primary source of credits) only resetting once every 3 hours and giving around 1k credits total when most mercs are around 50,000 credits each.

The loadout system adds more grind, you get loadout cards from cases that you can buy for 1k credits each or obtain at end of mission drops (and they are quite generous with the drop rates right now). However the issue is you get a random loadout card so it's highly likely you will get a ton of cards for mercs you don't even have unlocked and none for the ones you want. You can trade a specific amount of unused loadout cards to get one for a specific merc but again the one you get is completely random. You can buy loadout cards for like 15k credits if you want. Then we move onto elite cases which you can buy for real money which only give silver and up loadout cards, while lead and iron loadouts are completely viable it's highly likely someone with a silver one will have an advantage just because he has more perks. It's not pay to win in the slightest but it's worth a mention. Balance in Dirty Bomb is so so, some mercs are clearly better then others for specific roles and the overall team balance seems to be zero so most games end in a complete stomp for one side.

Overall would I recommend Dirty Bomb? Right now yes, it's fun enough. However it's worth a mention that Nexon of all companies is involved with this one. It's highly possible in the future they will introduce pay to win mechanics like they always do, play the game NOW if you want to play it as the Nexon involvement seems to be zero at this point so when they decide to get involved you will have had your fill and can move on.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
What is good about it;

-Good free to play model, you don't need to spend any real life money to do well or even get content held out to you.
-Good gameplay, pretty solid. Takes from Brink in a positive way, feels really rewarding, really solid, always no issues.
-Close to refined, nearly no bugs. There are a few minor graphic bugs but there are really none game breaking.
-Game modes are pretty well designed, a lot of fun to play on.
-Maps are well built.
-Nearly all the characters are balanced. Some more situational than others, some stronger, but nothing will win you or lose you the game if one character is present or absent while their role is filled. (No character x as medic but character y is a medic? No problem.)
-Good loadout sytem. It was done with the idea of balancing in mind. All cards above bronze are purely cosmetic and bronze cards are not hard to get.
-Getting characters is not difficult. Compared to League of Legends, you can get the more expensive characters faster than the 6300 IP champs.
-Not pay to win.
-Offers rewards from time to time after missions are a nice touch.

Where it can improve;

-More maps, more variety, more gamemodes. I know designing maps for this game is difficult due to balance issues, but 5 maps is still a few number. 6 including dome, a prototype map. There are 3 game modes, which can get dull when you sink 25 hours into this game.
-Better UI. Some things can change for the better when equiping loadouts.
-Party search, finding a game with friends is a hassle, youll almost awlays have one friend on the opposing side.
-More servers. While the servers are fine, dedicated servers, there is a lack for them. Most are inaccessible to higher level players as there are multiple level 5 or under servers.


Also, phantom needs to be reworked or removed. He is the MOST CRUTCH character in game. You cannot justify a 120/410 character with a 100 melee damage strike and damage reduction/invisibility. You cannot justify it takes skill, you cannot justify it is difficult, you cannot it is difficult to play, you cannot justify he contributes to the team like all the other classes save Vassilli.
