reviewText:
Very fun game. In 23 hours of gameplay I only have come across about 2 hackers in pub matches but have not played competitive yet. Gameplay is fast paced and the objectives are good, there are many situations that you really need to think and work as a team in order to complete the task at hand unless the opposing team is completely useless.

The merchs, classes and abilities are interesting and the maps work fairly well for the most part however there is not enough of them. Hoping that more maps will be released soon because the current maps are already starting to get a little boring.

There are still lots of new players in the game that do not understand how to use various mercs abilities which can be a little frustrating at times and there is generally little communication which is a cornerstone to team based games. Like most team games you will get players on your team that all they care about is sniping and they don't even assist with the objective, hunting players that are having no impact on the objective and not protecting teammates that are working on objectives. I do not understand why people like this play these team based objective games.

It would be good if there was some updates to loadout card management, being able to 'star' or select favorites that you use most often so that no mistakes are made when trading up cards. I don't think you can even check a cards abilities when in the trading screen. Another bonus would be if we can bind vsay commands to buttons so we do not need to use the menu system to issue commands.

Overall I am looking forward to future updates and hope that they resolve some of the issues that are currently plaguing the game and I also really hope they release some more content soon because I am concerned that the community will lose interest in this game if there is no action.

reviewText:
Das mit abstand beste f2p-modell zurzeit. Super gameplay, super performance.
Es gibt dinge die man fürs gameplay wissen sollte:

hier ma n paar tips:
1. MOVEMENT - immer in bewegung bleiben. Das ist kein bf,cs,cod,arma/etc Das spiel geht sogar eher in die Richtung Arenashooter.
2. Keine Ironsights benutzen - Bringt nichts, macht nur langsam und schrenkt das Sichtfeld ein
3. Man ist mit dem messer schneller beim rennen (ja, etwa so realistisch wie cs in dem punkt :D)
4.wenn man sprintet, ganz KURZ ducken (strg oder c) drückt und dann springt, macht man eine art boost-jump der einen nach vorne katapultiert (OFT BENUTZEN!!)
5. TEAMPLAY! - brauch man nichts mehr zu zu sagen.
6. Klassenwahl - Es gibt klassen die unfassbar schnell rennen. Z.B. Proxy. Wenn man die als Verteidiger hat, eignet sie sich wunderbar um z.b. durch kleine gänge hinter die gegner zu gehen, und diese zu flankieren. Oder mit ner heave klasse halt eher in der Nähe des Objectives bleiben. etc
7. Die medics sind nicht um sonst so schnell - immer zu gefallenen m8s laufen und diese wiederbeleben

So, hoffe ich konnte Neueinsteigern ein wenig helfen^^

reviewText:
So, let's address a couple things about Dirty Bomb.

This game seems to cop a lot of flak, most of which I believe is unsubstanciated.

First things first.

GRAPHICS AND ♥♥♥♥

They're pretty good.

PAY-TO-WIN AND ♥♥♥♥

Loadout cases are dropped completely randomly. They have 3 base rankings, Lead, Iron, and Bronze. Lead has one extra perk over the defult loadout, Iron has two, Bronze has three. There are also other cosmetic rankings that all have three perks, but these are functionally no differant then Bronze cards Do they make much of a differance? Not really. At the most you will get a 30% stat boost from each perk. None of them I've seen so far actually augment your ability to deal damage, rather they mostly focus on cutting skill cooldowns, your movement, reload times, etc.

Dispite the loadout cards are that are dropped by each case being totally random, it is not all that hard to get Bronze and Iron cards after a few hours of play. I have only about 40 hours and have about 6 irons and 4 bronze so far. While this does mean that you will find yourself playing other classes more than others, there is really no great decider in this game then skill. Firefights are over very quickly in this game.

If you want to spend the money, which is pricey by the way (about $10 USD for a single card!), you can. But I honestly have little trouble gunning down players who bought a gold Fletcher or Proxy for example with a stock Aura. Also if you play for about an hour a day, do at least three missions (500-1000 each, min 1.5K a day), and win at least one match of each three game modes (500 daily play, 500 each daily win, min 2K a day) it's easy to make about 5K credits a day. Play five times a week and you have enough to buy one of those mercs you've been playing with on rotation for the last fortnight.

Speaking of combat...

TEH GUNZ

Seriously, stop whining that the guns are unbalaced guys. THEY'RE ALL PRETTY INTERCHANGABLE IF YOU ASK ME. AIM FOR THE FARCKING HEAD KENT. You will do bugger all damange shooting someone in the chest, even with Rhino's minigun special. This is is not CoD or CS. Think more Enermy Territory.

THE COMMUNITY
Dunno how it is elsewhere but the Australian servers are fine. There has been a huge influx of new players recently but otherwise everyone seems to get along fine. The voting system is annoying as to pass anything, from a kick to a map restart to shuffling, you have to get like a 75% majority vote. Not impossible, not at all, but some people claim that 'votes never pass, voting is broken'. These people are all coming down from meth, don't listen to them.

And finally...

TEH L33T H4X0RZ

Seriously, AIM FOR THE BLASTED FAURK'N HEAD AND YOU'LL GET A KILL MATE.

I have seen one dude who may have been speed hacking in about 100 odd matches of this game. And he got kicked fast. Also, many of the lighter classes can get a perk which gives then a 30% faster sprint. I think they are the only classes that can get it and it does seem to make a massive differance as they can absoultly scoot around the map and knife you. This said, they're not that hard to counter, but god help you if you have more than 100 ping upagainst these ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.


THE LEGITIMATE CRITICISMS

There are plenty of random CTDs or disconnections.

Servers suffer regular ping spikes.

Support is somewhat non-exsistant and seems to be focused on issues other than induvidual player concerns

Yeah, there is only 8 maps in total at the moment.

Yeah, many players are dumb and you will see medics that don't heal, engineers that forget they can defuse/plant bombs, and heavies that are scared of bullets.

Stopwatch can be over brutally quick, but that's kind of why it's fun.

Lastly though, and this is rather important. RANKED MATCHMAKING IS BROKEN ON THE AU AND ASIA SERVERS. As in, does not work at all unless you live in North America or Europe. You can easily wait for 30 minutes on the AU or ASIA servers and not find a ranked match of any level, at all.

FINAL THOUGHTS

Go play it, ignore the people raining on this parade. They simply aren't used to games where ironsights are usually a bad idea, and hipfire is 85% as accurate, and only 3 classes have grenades, and you can't go prone.

It's silly, it's fun, it's colourful, it's nice and fast, and at the very least it'll be a nice warm up for Overwatch and Battleborn when they launch and hopefully don't completely crush this game, cause I like it.

reviewText:
Right now DB has been in 'testing' for what 3 years? Certainly 2 years I remember playing it way back on the nexon launcher with every merc available. Since that time I struggle to think of anything new that has been put in, Dome hasn't even been textured yet! Yes, there's execution but honestly that is the least popular mode in the game and I don't think that requires years of work.

We don't have all the mercs out yet (basically for cash grabbing reasons) and the mercs that do come out are buggy or poorly thought out. Sparks revivr bugged out on revives, rendered team mates invisible upon revive and still does too much damage to the EV/destructable side objectives. Phantom now on paper is just ridiculous, don't rly think he is too OP for 5v5 as he doesn't offer much in terms of gaining ground and securing objectives, in pubs however he is annoying as ♥♥♥♥. The concept of a cloak acting as a shield is completely counter-intuitive, if you get spotted and are getting shot at the cloak is no longer serving a purpose, they know you're there. Instead of being punished for your lack of stealth you are rewarded with 75 free health.

Why don't we have demos yet? Why don't we have our own private servers yet? Why doesn't ranked work yet? (ranked frequently puts you in a mis-matched lobby e.g. 4v6.) Why are merc re-releases taking so long? and when they are released they aren't in a very good state whatsoever.
Other than giving us blue reskins with cobalt tier loadout cards I'm not sure what is even happening at the SD offices each day.

TLDR: Looking forward to Overwatch.

Here's a google doc with all my feedback for the game:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1k-BMNhbnl_aq3x9HzQI30GPcmPmPcWWEXuKBAaMlghE/edit?usp=sharing

reviewText:
this game is a fast pace arena style shooter that requires team work. if you are unlucky enough to be on a team that doesnt work together. be ready to get stomped by a organized team. in fact the games only real set back is playing with random people that dont play their role. to many times has a medic ran right past 3 dying people just to get owned. or the ammo guy doesnt drop ammo.....EVER. but this game is a real blast while playing on good teams, with most matches being a photo finish.

each class has its own strong points and your objective suggest which class should be played. my personal favorite mercs are

PROXY for quick defuse and repair while it takes other classes 3x as long to do the job.

SKYHAMMER for pure rain of pain. this merc calls in air strikes which are very useful for large crowds and taking down the EV.

FRAGGER this guy doesnt really serve a purpose(that ive figured out yet) other then just out right killing. his heavy MG does plenty of damage forcing even the tank rhino to run for cover. with a good ammo guy at your side raining pain and dropping ammo the two should be able to supress an area.

i strongly suggest giving this game a try, its not p2w or freemium to me. because im doing pretty well and i havent dropped a dime. also everything that can be bought can be earned. again with a good team and focusing on the objects. you can earn credits rather fast.

also if their are any keys left pc gamer is giving away the merc fragger. ill even do the hard part for you lol. go here http://www.pcgamer.com/watch-the-full-dirty-bomb-e3-trailer-and-get-a-free-mercenary/

good luck on getting a key because they only had 100k to give out and enjoy the game.

reviewText:
What is Dirty Bomb?

Dirty Bomb is an objective-orientated competitive online shooter. Each match you pick three potential classes (mercenaries) you can freely swap between upon death. Class balance is asymmetrical. Each class has a role (Soldier, Support, Medic or Engineer), abilities to suit that role and a weapon set/movement model compliments combat at a certain range. Movement is quick like an arena shooter, with an Unreal Tournament style wall jump and Half Life style long jump helping you get around the maps. There is an aim down sights feature, however, due to the speed of movement and the accuracy of hip firing, aiming down sights is more niche than in other FPS games.

Competitive play is 5 v 5. Casual play is 6 v 6 to 8 v 8.

Pros

The skill ceiling in the game is very high and there's a lot of depth to mechanics. Many new FPS games shy away from features like sophisticated movement and health systems that made games like Quake so rich. Dirty Bomb is not one of these games.

Although strafing and crouching the standard evasion model, great players can also use long jumps and wall jumps to further increase evasion in the right situation. Perhaps even the odd standard jump in some niche circumstances. The maps are specifically built with jumps in mind and there are various spots that will provide you with good flanks or an advantage, with the right trick jump. The movement model has depth but it's also not obnoxiously powerful such as in games like Quake, people that haven't quite mastered it definitely stand a reasonable chance against people that have.

Health does regenerate slowly over time, however, if you don't have access to a medic, the down-time is somewhat punishing if your health bar is significantly depleted. Additionally, you spawn with only a few magazines of ammunition, meaning you will also need access to a Support character or the slower supplying and uncommon ammunition box, to regularly stock your pool.

The level design is good in the context of competitive play. It's not too open and not too “chokey”. There's usually 2 - 3 potential lanes you can take to push. The inclusion of optional but useful sub-objectives has also further enhanced the design by spreading combat out and giving people more targets to focus on.

Most of the small arms are solidly designed and satisfying to use. The bullets go where you shoot them! Most of the time, it's the better player that will win an engagement.

Balance may not be perfect but the game is very playable, as pretty much any class, in a non-competitive setting.

Cons

Casual play feels like a non-consideration. The maps are really too “chokey” and defender-orientated for public matches. Slowly regenerating health and low ammunition pools leave you gimped without a reliable medic and support on your team. It's hard for a single player to carry a bad team, however several competent players can make a huge difference, meaning you often get very imbalanced one sided public matches. Furthermore, several classes have abilities that are very frustrating to play against in the larger scale public matches (I'm looking at you “spammy” grenade launcher). I personally think this is a big thing because it means Splash Damage are overly limiting their target demographic - Dirty Bomb likely will not be able to sustain itself on “hardcore” competitive players alone.

Balance isn't quite there yet and some of the classes are straying in to hard counter territory levels of power. The soldier classes specifically feel like they're excessively superior to the others at killing. There are certain mechanics like high velocity cook-able one hit kill grenades and 1.5s immortality upon revive that obviously need to go.

In addition to the class balance problems, there seem to be some netcode issues occasionally, perhaps linked to lack of inertia on certain fast moving classes. Certain people forgo good aim and decide to spaz out strafing and/or jumping instead and/or crouching. Unfortunely, sometimes this nets these people the win because directional changes become game breakingly fast. Obviously this negatively impacts the competitiveness of the game quite a bit.

Although it's obviously early days yet, the game seems to really lack long term re-playability. You've probably seen all the game has to offer and reached close to maximum progression in a couple of hundreds hours of play, at best. Ranked queues are long and there is only the odd small scale tourne on weekends. There's little in the way of a competitive scene yet and a game like this sorely needs one. Early days though, this could easily change in time.

The business is currently okay, however, this might change. Progression is mildly P2W in the short term, however, viable competitive loadouts are quickly attainable, and at the end of the day, the progression cap isn't set that high. If you did want to spend money to reduce your grind everything would only cost ~£30, at the time of writing. This price will definately go up every time a new class is released though. (Bare in mind you don't necessarily need everything though and can also mix/match paying and buying content for in-game currency.)

Other minor cons: The UI is laggy. The vote interface isn't very obvious and intuitive. Pub stomping premades allowing on casual servers. The odd hacker and no clear way to report them.

Conclusion

If you like fast paced competitive shooters this game is worth a try. It has its flaws and it's definitely no CS, UT or Quake, however, it's something new that's relatively rich. That's something you don't see all that often in this time where we're bombarded with low skill floor modern shooters and not much else.

reviewText:
Amazingly fun game. It's good looking and challenging, since it's a very team based game. The class and character system is just great, you can unlock different type of loadouts for each character, just by playing the game and earning crates.

Overall, it's a great and outstanding Free2Play-Shooter. You can buy all characters with the ingame-currency, but also with real money.
Every 6 to 8 hours you will get new daylies to earn more currency, it's up to you if you want to farm or microtransaction characters.

The Mec Starter Pack is also a great deal, since you get cool and very useful characters right of the bat.

9/10 would bang again.

reviewText:
After over 60 hours of playtime, I am in love with this game. I don't get why people call this game p2w, since the grind for getting a 50k merc is about the same as getting a new champion in League of Legends now, you get occasional card cases as drops just by playing a few matches, you can always trade up cards for a higher tier, and you only need up to Bronze to play competitive, which is easy to get. Everything above Bronze are just skins.

The Time to Kill an enemy is slow, but that's because you are probab ly not aiming for heads. In today's FPS shooters (Call of Duty, etc.), I am more focus on just landing shots on the dude and get a kill within seconds. In Dirty Bomb, you have to focus on getting headshots, which is nice since I'm no longer mindlessly poining my cursor around and getting kills like that.

The parkour, although limited, is fun to use. There is basically just two simple things, the Wall Jump and the Long Jump. Though, with these two togethor, it opens up more routes to flank the enemy team at. My favorite is wall jumping over a crate and getting enemies that are behind said crate.

Though, currently as of this review, the game has a lot of technical issues, though the devs are constantly trying to improve their game, so give it some time.

The only real issue that I have are the prices of everything in the store in terms of real-life currency, but that's about it.

Overall, I give this game a 9/10

reviewText:
I only have one criticizing thought with this game. And it's been irritating me to every degree.
How do we make this game more popular?
Seriously. This game has amazing potential to compete with games like CS:GO, Dota 2, CoD, and more! So why hasn't it happened? What's the community doing wrong to draw in new players? Is there something the devs could do? The player count right now is certainly large and will most definitely keep you entertained, but if you're a new player, the slightly limited field of experience between players will leave you feeling intimidated and make you feel like you need to take this game really seriously. This game is beautiful, with a sort of TF2/Overwatch mixed with CoD sort of art style, with unique gameplay mechanics, and lovable, enjoyable characters. Things are balanced, there are just enough maps to keep things interesting, and regarding maps, each map is HUGE. MUCH bigger than one would expect out of a fast paced FPS. Please, if you're someone who plans on trying this game out, don't hesitate. Even though the player count is nowhere near as high as it can be, you're someone who can help change that. New players who find the game enjoyable and welcoming for them will help to draw in even more new players.

In this game's current state, I rate it a 9/10. It's a REALLY fun game. I LOVE playing classes like Redeye, that toss in unique gameplay mechanics that you won't find in other games like CS:GO. The characters have personalities that you can relate to, much like TF2. And its fast paced, addictive FPS action will keep having you come back for more. I think it's safe to say I like this game more than CS:GO, a game I spent considerably more money on, and have roughly 3x the hours on compared to this game.

reviewText:
Dirty bomb is quite fun, out of the time I've played it I've not had too many moments where I've gotten board off the game itself, rather my awful attention span. My only real complaint so far with the game is you better make damn sure the first merc you buy is the one you want, the grind to buy mercs for free is absurd with the missions (primary source of credits) only resetting once every 3 hours and giving around 1k credits total when most mercs are around 50,000 credits each.

The loadout system adds more grind, you get loadout cards from cases that you can buy for 1k credits each or obtain at end of mission drops (and they are quite generous with the drop rates right now). However the issue is you get a random loadout card so it's highly likely you will get a ton of cards for mercs you don't even have unlocked and none for the ones you want. You can trade a specific amount of unused loadout cards to get one for a specific merc but again the one you get is completely random. You can buy loadout cards for like 15k credits if you want. Then we move onto elite cases which you can buy for real money which only give silver and up loadout cards, while lead and iron loadouts are completely viable it's highly likely someone with a silver one will have an advantage just because he has more perks. It's not pay to win in the slightest but it's worth a mention. Balance in Dirty Bomb is so so, some mercs are clearly better then others for specific roles and the overall team balance seems to be zero so most games end in a complete stomp for one side.

Overall would I recommend Dirty Bomb? Right now yes, it's fun enough. However it's worth a mention that Nexon of all companies is involved with this one. It's highly possible in the future they will introduce pay to win mechanics like they always do, play the game NOW if you want to play it as the Nexon involvement seems to be zero at this point so when they decide to get involved you will have had your fill and can move on.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
What is good about it;

-Good free to play model, you don't need to spend any real life money to do well or even get content held out to you.
-Good gameplay, pretty solid. Takes from Brink in a positive way, feels really rewarding, really solid, always no issues.
-Close to refined, nearly no bugs. There are a few minor graphic bugs but there are really none game breaking.
-Game modes are pretty well designed, a lot of fun to play on.
-Maps are well built.
-Nearly all the characters are balanced. Some more situational than others, some stronger, but nothing will win you or lose you the game if one character is present or absent while their role is filled. (No character x as medic but character y is a medic? No problem.)
-Good loadout sytem. It was done with the idea of balancing in mind. All cards above bronze are purely cosmetic and bronze cards are not hard to get.
-Getting characters is not difficult. Compared to League of Legends, you can get the more expensive characters faster than the 6300 IP champs.
-Not pay to win.
-Offers rewards from time to time after missions are a nice touch.

Where it can improve;

-More maps, more variety, more gamemodes. I know designing maps for this game is difficult due to balance issues, but 5 maps is still a few number. 6 including dome, a prototype map. There are 3 game modes, which can get dull when you sink 25 hours into this game.
-Better UI. Some things can change for the better when equiping loadouts.
-Party search, finding a game with friends is a hassle, youll almost awlays have one friend on the opposing side.
-More servers. While the servers are fine, dedicated servers, there is a lack for them. Most are inaccessible to higher level players as there are multiple level 5 or under servers.


Also, phantom needs to be reworked or removed. He is the MOST CRUTCH character in game. You cannot justify a 120/410 character with a 100 melee damage strike and damage reduction/invisibility. You cannot justify it takes skill, you cannot justify it is difficult, you cannot it is difficult to play, you cannot justify he contributes to the team like all the other classes save Vassilli.

reviewText:
Very fun game. In 23 hours of gameplay I only have come across about 2 hackers in pub matches but have not played competitive yet. Gameplay is fast paced and the objectives are good, there are many situations that you really need to think and work as a team in order to complete the task at hand unless the opposing team is completely useless.

The merchs, classes and abilities are interesting and the maps work fairly well for the most part however there is not enough of them. Hoping that more maps will be released soon because the current maps are already starting to get a little boring.

There are still lots of new players in the game that do not understand how to use various mercs abilities which can be a little frustrating at times and there is generally little communication which is a cornerstone to team based games. Like most team games you will get players on your team that all they care about is sniping and they don't even assist with the objective, hunting players that are having no impact on the objective and not protecting teammates that are working on objectives. I do not understand why people like this play these team based objective games.

It would be good if there was some updates to loadout card management, being able to 'star' or select favorites that you use most often so that no mistakes are made when trading up cards. I don't think you can even check a cards abilities when in the trading screen. Another bonus would be if we can bind vsay commands to buttons so we do not need to use the menu system to issue commands.

Overall I am looking forward to future updates and hope that they resolve some of the issues that are currently plaguing the game and I also really hope they release some more content soon because I am concerned that the community will lose interest in this game if there is no action.

reviewText:
Closed Beta review:

Game is actually fun to play. The claims about balance issues is there because people haven't put the time in to understand the system on which the loadout cards are done. Right now, credits are easily obtained through normal gameplay. You can gain about 12k from a victory, while getting 7k for a loss, and that's a full game where you joined in from the start. With your credits you can purchase Loadout cases for 1k each, which comes with a loadout card. You then use these cards to upgrade to the next tier. So 3 iron cards, equals to one bronze card. Then 4 bronze cards to one silver, then 4 silver to one gold. Essentially, per win, you can obtain a single bronze card. Put the math in and in about 3-4 hours you can have a gold card.

Balance issues aren't really a decent claim from users. Due to this being a class" based combat system

reviewText: Dirty Bomb is probably the best shooter I've played in years. As the spiritual successor of Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory and being developed by the same team, I can only say how happy I am to finally see Wolf ET in the modern day. That's not to say that Dirty Bomb is a mere clone, because it really isn't. When it comes right down to it, Dirty Bomb is just a mix of elements already seen in other shooters. However, it is the way that Dirty Bomb mixes these elements that makes it a game worth playing. Take all the good things about Wolf ET, Brink, Country Strike and Team Fortress 2 and you get one helluva fun time. That one helluva fun time is Dirty Bomb. With fast paced action, loveable mercenaries and a very fair monotization system, there's no reason not to give Dirty Bomb a go! What are you waiting for? It's time to play dirty!
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: This is my favorite F2P game. You can play it simplistically or complicated and still have a good time. I love the speed of everything and the sense of momentum. The twitch based gunplay is top notch and all of the weapons are fun and fairly well balanced. The character roster rotates periodically so you will be able to play as any character without spending a dime. There are even promotions occasionally which give free characters or loadouts. The characters are all very unique and enjoyable and the world is vibrant and beautiful and very stylized. Every other FPS that I play now just feels sluggish and unengaging.\nThe game does need more optimizing and the community might be getting smaller but those are the only two negatives I have to say.\nI highly suggest Dirty Bomb!
